intro: Senecio quaylei, commonly known as the Quaylei groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, bristly seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
